---
title: GHQ 12 vs TSQ
url: "/compare-harmonise-instruments/ghq-12-vs-tsq/"
date: 2025-01-15
---

## GHQ 12 vs TSQ

Software In the world of psychological research, comparison of different questionnaires can provide valuable insights. A very pertinent juxtaposition is that of GHQ 12 vs TSQ. These two standard instruments are frequently used in mental health research. GHQ-12, or General Health Questionnaire, is popular for its brevity and effectiveness in detecting psychological distress. On the other hand, TSQ, the Trauma Screening Questionnaire, is extensively used to screen individuals for post-traumatic stress disorder. Harmony, a software developed specifically for psychologists, can facilitate understanding the correlations and disparities between the two instruments. Comparing GHQ 12 vs TSQ manually is a strenuous task which requires careful analysis. Moreover, the process is likely to introduce a subjective bias. This is where Harmony shines. Utilizing natural language processing and AI models, Harmony can efficiently harmonize the questionnaire items of these two instruments, simplifying the task for psychologists. Harmony can not only match the questions within the questionnaires, but also evaluate the degree of match, enhancing the quality of research involving GHQ 12 vs TSQ. Harmony encourages researchers to delve deeper into their investigations of GHQ 12 vs TSQ. This is accomplished by making the process of comparison user-friendly, precise, and multilingual. Researchers can leverage the rich database of Harmony or upload their questionnaires in the software. Embrace the convenience Harmony brings to the research process and explore the complexities between GHQ 12 and TSQ with a fresh, digital approach.
